intro: Hieracium nystuense, commonly known as the Nystuens hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are usually basal, with a rough texture. Hieracium nystuense is often found in open habitats and can sometimes be invasive in certain regions.
